parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A complaint, fault, blame. From memphomai; blame, i.e., a fault.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
